issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When tried to created more than 10 tags using the console, it ended up creating 11 tags total, however rejected 12th tag creation.

See the attachment.

comments.body: Not sure if the CLC will accept 11 tags.  Need to determine if there's an error message with 11th tag that's not being honored by the Console.  [~viglesias] to check test (which does check for 10 tag max in CLC).  Then reassign to someone on console team
Server is showing that it is accepted but the tags are not actually shown in describe tags.
[~viglesias] just created 15 tags and it returns success but it actually only creates 10.

I think false is good enough. A lot of API calls return true/false, as you know. It may just be incumbent on the console to make sure we look for that. I think we do in a lot of cases, but this might have been overlooked.
From boto's and euca2ools's standpoint, the most important thing is that the server responds with an appropriate HTTP status code when an error occurs.

This is failing in todays 'testing' build
{code}
[h-22:~]euca-create-group mygroup -d 'A new group'
GROUP	sg-52EB4173	mygroup	A new group
[h-22:~]euca-create-tags --tag a=1 --tag b=1 --tag c=1 --tag d=1 --tag e=1 --tag f=1 --tag g=1 --tag h=1 --tag i=1 --tag j=1 --tag k=1 --tag l=1 mygroup
TAG		mygroup	a	1
TAG		mygroup	b	1
TAG		mygroup	c	1
TAG		mygroup	d	1
TAG		mygroup	e	1
TAG		mygroup	f	1
TAG		mygroup	g	1
TAG		mygroup	h	1
TAG		mygroup	i	1
TAG		mygroup	j	1
TAG		mygroup	k	1
{code}
You cannot use a group name with tagging, only a group identifier.

You can also add tags for non-existent groups:
{code}
[h-22:~]euca-create-tags --tag a=1 --tag b=1 --tag c=1 --tag d=1 --tag e=1 --tag f=1 --tag g=1 --tag h=1 --tag i=1 --tag j=1 --tag k=1 bogus-group
TAG		bogus-group	a	1
TAG		bogus-group	b	1
TAG		bogus-group	c	1
TAG		bogus-group	d	1
TAG		bogus-group	e	1
TAG		bogus-group	f	1
TAG		bogus-group	g	1
TAG		bogus-group	h	1
TAG		bogus-group	i	1
TAG		bogus-group	j	1
TAG		bogus-group	k	1
{code}
this bug is fixed I will open new bugs for the two other issues
